member.name: IDWriteFactory2.CreateCustomRenderingParams
member.summary: Creates a rendering parameters object with the specified properties.
member.param: The gamma value used for gamma correction, which must be greater than zero and cannot exceed 256.
The amount of contrast enhancement, zero or greater.
The amount of contrast enhancement, zero or greater.
The degree of ClearType level, from 0.0f (no ClearType) to 1.0f (full ClearType).
The geometry of a device pixel.
Method of rendering glyphs. In most cases, this should be DWRITE_RENDERING_MODE_DEFAULT to automatically use an appropriate mode.
How to grid fit glyph outlines. In most cases, this should be DWRITE_GRID_FIT_DEFAULT to automatically choose an appropriate mode.
Holds the newly created rendering parameters object, or NULL in case of failure.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDWriteFactory2.CreateFontFallbackBuilder

summary.para: Creates a font fallback builder object.
A font fall back builder allows you to create Unicode font fallback mappings and create a font fall back object from those mappings.

member.param: Contains an address of a pointer to the newly created font fallback builder object.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDWriteFactory2.CreateGlyphRunAnalysis
member.summary: Creates a glyph run analysis object, which encapsulates information used to render a glyph run.
member.param: Structure specifying the properties of the glyph run.
Optional transform applied to the glyphs and their positions. This transform is applied after the scaling specified by the emSize and pixelsPerDip.
Specifies the rendering mode, which must be one of the raster rendering modes (i.e., not default and not outline).
Specifies the method to measure glyphs.
How to grid-fit glyph outlines. This must be non-default.
Specifies the antialias mode.
Horizontal position of the baseline origin, in DIPs.
Vertical position of the baseline origin, in DIPs.
Receives a pointer to the newly created object.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDWriteFactory2.GetSystemFontFallback
member.summary: Creates a font fallback object from the system font fallback list.
member.param: Contains an address of a pointer to the newly created font fallback object.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IDWriteFactory2.TranslateColorGlyphRun
member.summary: This method is called on a glyph run to translate it in to multiple color glyph runs.
member.param: The horizontal baseline origin of the original glyph run.
The vertical baseline origin of the original glyph run.
Original glyph run containing monochrome glyph IDs.
Optional glyph run description.
Measuring mode used to compute glyph positions if the run contains color glyphs.

World transform multiplied by any DPI scaling. This is needed to compute glyph positions if the run contains color glyphs and the measuring mode is not . If this parameter is NULL, and identity transform is assumed.
Zero-based index of the color palette to use. Valid indices are less than the number of palettes in the font, as returned by .

If the original glyph run contains color glyphs, this parameter receives a pointer to an interface. The client uses the returned interface to get information about glyph runs and associated colors to render instead of the original glyph run. If the original glyph run does not contain color glyphs, this method returns DWRITE_E_NOCOLOR and the output pointer is NULL.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.
